Can we please be more explicit here. For example:

```pdr: Rename pldm_pdr_find_container_id_range_exclude()```
Done
This should be "renamed"
Done

Can you please mention in the commit message that the change addresses the comment below (i.e. include the link in the commit message as well):

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/63615/comment/439b3560_78f6dbbc/
Done
Can you please add `Fixes: 5dc025719dc3 (“pdr: Add pldm_pdr_find_container_id_range_exclude() API”)` above this line
Done

Hi Pavithra. Each commit needs to address a single problem. This commit addresses multiple problems. Not only that, but it leaves the fact that it addresses a correctness bug unmentioned in the commit message.

Please make separate changes for the separate problems:

1. Fix the name of the function
2. Fix the fact that it returns failure even if the relevant child container ID is found.

I've mentioned in my comments on the commit message that you need to add a `Fixes: ...` tag. Please do this for both commits I've asked for above.

IMO you can drop the line wrapping changes. I've left more comments on that inline.
Trailing whitespace needs to be removed.
Done

Contrary to Arun's comment there's no need to line wrap this IMO as the project line wrap point is set at 120 characters, not 80. It was fine as it was.

However, if you feel the need to wrap the line then please also indent it as it was prior to your change.
Ack
As above.
Done
Trailing whitespace needs to be removed.
Ack

I don't think it still matches with function. The PDR can have N number of child containedEntitys. In this function you are directly picking the first child and not finding/searching with in N continedEntities.

Maybe you need to loop through the contained entities and find the matching one.

Arun, as per spec DSP0248 (section 11.3) all the child containedEntitys have the same container ids. So if we return the first child contained entity it will be the same for all the contained entities for that particular parent.
@Pavithra that is an excellent reference and explanation. Can you please include this information in the commit message?
Done

I see that in DSP0248 (section 11.3) has the example with same containerID for all the child. But I believe spec is not mandating it and it is not true always. Especially in case of a logical containment association. 
Please refer DSP0248 (section 22.1, 11.4 and 11.6)

Eg: Let's say we have a 'power supply unit' which contains 2 power supplies connected to 2 different PDBs. In that case the container IDs can differ. Let's say we choose to use different container IDs since the PDBs are of different models from different vendors.
Now if I model an entity association PDR to represent entire logical power supply unit, then it will have child entities (power supply) with different container ids(container IDs of PDBs).

Arun, Could you please explain it with a diagram? I am not following you. AFAIK, every child-contained entity will have the same container ID always. Only the parent container id can be different. Even though if child container id differs, the entity instance number and entity type should match and only then container id is returned corresponding to that.

I was talking about a logical entity association PDR which can looks something like this.

```
                           SYSTEM
+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                 |
|                 PDB 1 with continer ID 123                      |
|         +----------------------------------------+              |
|         |                                        |              |
|         |                                        |              |
|         |         Logical power supply           |              |
|   +-----+----------------------------------------+----+         |
|   |     |                                        |    |         |
|   |     |    +-------------------------------+   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    | Physical power supply 1       |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    | Continer ID = 123             |   |    |         |
|   |     |    +-------------------------------+   |    |         |
|   |     |                                        |    |         |
|   |     |        Continer ID = SYSTEM            |    |         |
|   |     +----------------------------------------+    |         |
|   |                                                   |         |
|   |            PDB 2 with continer ID 345             |         |
|   |     +----------------------------------------+    |         |
|   |     |                                        |    |         |
|   |     |                                        |    |         |
|   |     |    +-------------------------------+   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |   Physical power supply 2     |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |    Continer ID = 345          |   |    |         |
|   |     |    |                               |   |    |         |
|   |     |    +-------------------------------+   |    |         |
|   |     |                                        |    |         |
|   +-----+----------------------------------------+----+         |
|         |                                        |              |
|         |                                        |              |
|         |                                        |              |
|         |        Continer ID = SYSTEM            |              |
|         +----------------------------------------+              |
|                                                                 |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
```

Where the Entity association PDR for logical power supply will look like below
```
Container Entity
containerID = SYSTEM

entityType = logical | Power Supply
entityInstanceNumber = 1
containerID = SYSTEM

associationType = logical containment

Contained Entity 1
entityType = physical | Power Supply
entityInstanceNumber = 1
containerID = 123

Contained Entity 2 
entityType = physical | Power Supply 
entityInstanceNumber = 1 
containerID = 345 
```

Further discussions were made offline (discord - https://discord.com/channels/775381525260664832/778790638563885086/1122892556989108435) and concluded to rename the API as pldm_pdr_find_child_container_id_index_range_exclude() which takes child index as an argument.
Made changes based on the discussion.

This takes the patch beyond just "renaming the function". This must be a separate commit with its own justification. There's no mention of this fix anywhere in the commit message, or why it's correct.
Ack

Please delete the blank line here. The `Fixes:` tag must form part of the "commit trailer" as the final paragraph. This is important as git has tooling to extract these "trailers". Being consistent with the tags means we can exploit the tooling to understand our development behaviours by inspection:

https://git-scm.com/docs/git-interpret-trailers
Done
At this point we're not just renaming it but reworking it. Let's say as much here by swapping "Rename" for "Rework"
Done

What editor do you use to write your commit messages? Can we configure it to hard-wrap at the appropriate width? For instance in vim you can use `gq` to wrap the text:

https://vimhelp.org/change.txt.html#gq
Done, I use vim editor and I made use of `gq` to wrap the text.
Hi Pavithra, my main concerns are around fixing the changelog to correctly reflect the function name and also clarifying the behaviour of the function in the documentation for the corner cases.
This needs to match the new function name.
Done
nit: May be split the comments into 2 lines(80-character limit)?
Done
This is a bit of a nitpick, but can we put the parameter before the range so its position aligns with the function name?
Done
Adjust the position of the child_index parameter in accordance with the comment on the header.
Done

Is this the behaviour we want? I'm not suggesting that this is wrong, I'm just after confirmation or clarification. It seems inconsistent with the `continue` on line 415 if `pdr->num_children == 0` holds.

Whatever the case, the behaviour under these conditions should be described in the doxygen for the function.
Ack, I was wrong, we must continue from that loop and check for the next matching record.
I suppose you are planning to add `return 0;` in another path set.
yes, moved it before this commit as per Andrew's suggestion.
Hi Pavithra, apologies in advance but I missed commenting on a bug that was present in the previous patch. I've outlined the reasoning in the comments.
We can't update the `[0.3.0]` section, it's already been tagged. The change in this patch needs to be noted as a separate entry under the `Fixes` heading in the `[Unreleased]` section
Done
Ack
With the changes and reasoning above we can delete this.
Done
